name: Kepler-247
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-247 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-247 is a star with 0.665 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.77 times its radius. It is located 2206.05 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-247 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-247 b

Kepler-247 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.34 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-247.

The mass of Kepler-247 b is 3.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-247 b is 1.64 that of Earth. At 3.14 Earth masses, Kepler-247 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-247 c

Kepler-247 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.44 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-247.

The mass of Kepler-247 c is 28.29 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-247 c is 4.09 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-247 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-247 d

Kepler-247 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.48 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-247.

The mass of Kepler-247 d is 25.93 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-247 d is 3.94 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-247 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-247, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
